content.raw:
I've looked further into the `MaximumDissipation` test failure and created an example world in [branch friction_cone_test](#!/osrf/gazebo/compare/friction_cone_test%0Ddefault#diff) to show how it's failing. To run it, I recommend building and installing this `torsional_friction_louise` branch, then downloading the [world_edit folder from the friction_cone_test branch](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/friction_cone_test/examples/plugins/world_edit/), building and running as follows:

~~~
# make sure to source the gazebo setup.sh file
# it is probably in a different location
. /usr/share/gazebo/setup.sh
cd world_edit
export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=$GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH:$PWD/models
mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. && make
export GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH=$GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH:$PWD
gazebo --verbose ../world_edit.world
~~~

Two boxes aligned with the x and y axes (`box_x`, `box_y`) behave as expected. One of the boxes (`box_yx`) doesn't move in a straight line but follows a piecewise linear trajectory. The other box (`box_xy`) looks ok but I haven't verified its path numerically. See a [video here](https://vimeo.com/136882831) (once it finishes converting).

Maybe @rosebudflyaway has an idea of how to fix it?
content.html:
I've looked further into the MaximumDissipation test failure and created an example world in branch friction_cone_test to show how it's failing. To run it, I recommend building and installing this torsional_friction_louise branch, then downloading the world_edit folder from the friction_cone_test branch, building and running as follows:

# make sure to source the gazebo setup.sh file
# it is probably in a different location
. /usr/share/gazebo/setup.sh
cd world_edit
export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=$GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH:$PWD/models
mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. && make
export GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH=$GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH:$PWD
gazebo --verbose ../world_edit.world

Two boxes aligned with the x and y axes (box_x, box_y) behave as expected. One of the boxes (box_yx) doesn't move in a straight line but follows a piecewise linear trajectory. The other box (box_xy) looks ok but I haven't verified its path numerically. See a video here (once it finishes converting).

Maybe @rosebudflyaway has an idea of how to fix it?
